profile_positions.description:
Swap, Shop & Go Events (SSG) is an un-registered start up organizing swap shops, fashion markets and flea-market events in Maastricht by and with students, for students. Our mission is to make secondhand, frugal and sustainable possibilities for fellow students. 

Established in 2012 from my living room to regular rotating events organized by a team with collaborators including Maastricht University, the WE festival and The InnBetween. 

Personal responsibilities and experiences:
Organize and host flea-market style events, fashion markets and swap shops
Manage seller participants
Book keeping
Organizing collaborations with other companies
Branding and marketing 
Graphic design for advertisement
Budgeting
Leading a team
Recruiting 
Interviewing 
Time management and planning

volunteer_experiences.description: Secretary role within the board of the VVE Meer en Vaart, Amsterdam.

I attended the Leaders for Nature Forum in Eindhoven on the 17th of April 2015, to help DSM with their sustainability challenge. The multidisciplinary conference, organized by IUCN and Except, was to aid 10 large companies in the Netherlands with their sustainability challenges. I worked with DSM and other professionals to come up with a communication strategy to inspire DSM employees to integrate social and environmental value systems into their everyday practices.

The WE festival is a collaborative consumption, sharing economy oriented festival, hosted in Maastricht, The Netherlands in the month of May. At the festival I co-ordinated the set up and creation of a swap shop for clothing, shoes and accesories in order to raise awareness on the waste of textiles and the reusing and repurposing of secondhand.

Laura Lima, a Brazilian artist, is having an exhibition at the Bonnefantenmuseum between October and January, in which I volunteer to be incorporated into the artwork. For the piece called 'the toilet', where a pair of hands come out of the wall to hold the mirror above the fully functioning bathroom sink, in the public toilet on the same level as the exhibition, I volunteered to hold the mirror.

At the WE festival in May 2014 in Maastricht, The Netherlands, I co-ordinated a fashion show to show secondhand clothing. The clothing was collected from donation, charity shops, secondhand shops and vintage shops to be showcased at the fashion show. I collected clothing, styled outfits, recruited models, designed the runway, lead the models backstage and was in charge of the running order.
I lead a team of 5 to organize and hosts social events for the members of the study assosciation Orakel at Maastricht University.

I was member of the events committee, internally known as the Links committee, from the study assosciation Orakel at Maastricht University. I was part of a team of 6 students, organizing and hosting social events for the members of the assosciation.

Due to the CAS program I volunteered a lot during my two years of International Baccalaureate. I worked at a charity shop, was ambassador for the school and attended conferences abroad. I organized fashion clubs, joined the annual performing arts show, taught English and Dutch.
Representing UWCM in Dutch publications and at conferences for example at the Dutch Ministry of Education in The Hague, The Netherlands and TASIS, United Kingdom

I volunteered at a Terre des Hommes Charity shop to be a sales assistance of donated clothing. Tasks included pricing items, cleaning the store and stockroom, organizing the stock and interacting with customers.
